com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib
Class DfpUser

java.lang.Object
  com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib.DfpUser

public class DfpUser
extends java.lang.Object

The DfpUser class contains all needed information to authenticate a user as well as generate a valid service for that user. The way in which a service is generated is performed as:

DfpUser user = new DfpUser(email, password, networkCode, applicationName, true);
ServiceInterface service = user.getService(DfpService.version.serviceName);

The interface <Service>Interface should match that described by DfpService.version.serviceName or else a ServiceException will be thrown. For example, if you wished to get the service InventoryService and you referenced this service by DfpService.v201004.INVENTORY_SERVICE, your import of InventoryServiceInterface should be from the package com.google.api.ads.dfp.v201004.

Author:
api.arogal@gmail.com (Adam Rogal)

DfpUser

public DfpUser(java.lang.String email,
               java.lang.String password,
               java.lang.String applicationName)
Constructor defaults to using the sandbox environment and does not supply a network. This constructor assumes the user only has one network.

Parameters:
email - the email address of the user
password - the password
applicationName - the application name

Method Detail

getService

public <T extends java.rmi.Remote> T getService(DfpService service)
                                     throws javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException
Gets an instantiated service generated for this user determined by service. Should be used in the form: ServiceNameInterface service = user.getService(DfpService.Version.Service); where ServiceNameInterface is described in the javadoc within DfpService.Version.Service, and both Version and Service are constants.

Type Parameters:
T - the type determined by the return-capture variable to cast the generated stub to.
Parameters:
service - the DfpService used to generate the service
Returns:
the instantiated service for this user
Throws:
javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException - if service stub could not be generated or if the return-capture variable's type does not match the service requested

public <T extends java.rmi.Remote> T getService(DfpService service,

                                     throws javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException
Gets an instantiated service generated for this user determined by service. Should be used in the form: ServiceNameInterface service = user.getService(DfpService.Version.Service); where ServiceNameInterface is described in the javadoc within DfpService.Version.Service, and both Version and Service are constants.

Type Parameters:
T - the type determined by the return-capture variable to cast the generated stub to.
Parameters:
service - the DfpService used to generate the service
endpointServer - the endpoint server of the service
Returns:
the instantiated service for this user

javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException - if service stub could not be generated or if the return-capture variable's type does not match the service requested

getRegisteredAuthToken

public java.lang.String getRegisteredAuthToken()
Gets the registered authentication token associated with this user. This method does not generate a new authentication token; use the AuthToken.getAuthToken() method to do this. This can be null if the authentication token was never set.

Returns:
the registered authentication token with this user

setAuthToken

public void setAuthToken(java.lang.String authToken)
Sets the authentication token that is retrieved by getRegisteredAuthToken(). This authentication token will be used when generating services; i.e. getService(DfpVersion.*.*).

Parameters:
authToken - the authentication token to use when generating services

useClasspathClientConfig

public static void useClasspathClientConfig(boolean useClasspathClientConfig)
Uses the client-config.wsdd located in the classpath instead of loading the runtime EngineConfiguration, which sets the HTTP transport to DfpHttpSender.

Parameters:
useClasspathClientConfig - true if the client-config.wsdd located in the classpath should be used

getUseClasspathClientConfig

public static boolean getUseClasspathClientConfig()
Returns true if the DfpServiceFactory should use the client-config.wsdd located in the classpath instead of loading the runtime EngineConfiguration. See useClasspathClientConfig(boolean).

Returns:
true if the client-config.wsdd located in the classpath should be used

the client library identifier used for user-agent fields
